story:
Once upon a time, in a land filled with towering trees and sparkling streams, there was a kind and curious little girl named Lily. Lily lived in a cozy cabin in the woods with her mother, who was a skilled weaver, and her father, who was a wise and gentle gardener.

Lily loved to explore the woods and discover all the wonders that lived there. She would spend hours wandering through the forest, examining the plants and animals she found along the way.

One day, as Lily was playing near a babbling brook, she heard a soft rustling in the bushes. She peered inside and was delighted to see a tiny, sparkling fairy! The fairy had wings that shimmered in the sunlight and a dress made of the most beautiful flowers Lily had ever seen.

Lily was thrilled to have found a real fairy and she carefully reached out her hand to try and touch the fairy's wings. But as soon as she did, the fairy flitted away, leaving a trail of glittering fairy dust in her wake.

Determined to become friends with the fairy, Lily spent the next few days trying to find her again. She left out treats and flowers, hoping to lure the fairy back to her.

Finally, after many days of searching, Lily heard the soft rustling of the fairy's wings once again. She held very still and watched as the fairy fluttered down to land on her outstretched hand.

The fairy looked up at Lily and smiled. "Thank you for the treats and flowers," she said. "I am Celeste, the fairy of the woods. I have been watching you and I can see that you are kind and curious, just like me. I would like to be your friend."

Lily was overjoyed and she and Celeste became the best of friends. They spent their days exploring the woods together, having picnics by the brook, and playing games.

As the years passed, Lily grew up to be a kind and gentle woman, just like her parents. She never forgot about her friend Celeste and the magical adventures they shared in the woods. And every time she saw a sparkle of fairy dust, she knew that Celeste was never far away.

The end. Goodnight my dear. Sweet dreams.
